thread.title: Prickly Jose Mourinho slams BBC reporter and storms out of interview following Manchester United's draw with Hull
thread.title_full: Prickly Jose Mourinho slams BBC reporter and storms out of interview following Manchester United's draw with Hull

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Prickly Jose Mourinho slams BBC reporter and storms out of interview following Manchester United's draw with Hull
text:
Sport Prickly Jose Mourinho slams BBC reporter and storms out of interview   draw with Hull The Red Devils boss was disgruntled by several   and claimed the reporter did not know anything about football Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 'Angry' Jose Mourinho walks out of TV interview Share this video Get   
A visibly disgruntled Jose Mourinho stormed out of his BBC interview on Wednesday night following Manchester United 's goalless draw with Hull. 
The Red Devils boss was clearly angry over several   and decided to take his rage out on BBC commentator Martin Fisher. 
United dominated the play and had 15 shots compared to Hull's two. And the six home shots that were on target were all brilliantly denied by Eldin Jakupovic. 
But controversial moments in the game arose surrounding Hull striker Oumar Niasse. The on-loan Everton player could arguably have seen straight red for two separate challenges. Mourinho gave short one-word answers (Photo: BBC) 
And Mourinho couldn't hide his frustration with the official's decisions at full-time. 
"I think Hull City tried to see where they could go," he said. "The way they could behave and tried to see what the referee would allow them to do. Mourinho storms out of interview (Photo: BBC) 
"They had the feedback and were comfortable to do what they did. I am not critical of that. They are fighting against relegation and every point is gold. 
"If you do not know football, you should not have a microphone in your hand."
